macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Futures Steady After Soft CPI Data Amid Holiday Trading
items.summary: US stock futures showed little change on February 16 with S&P 500 futures up 0.1%, Nasdaq 100 down 0.2%, and Dow up 0.2%, following softer-than-expected January CPI data that boosted Federal Reserve rate cut expectations for June or July. Markets were closed for Presidents' Day, with recent weakness in major indices due to AI disruption concerns.

items.title: Global Indices Mixed: KOSPI Leads Gainers, S&P/TSX Biggest Loser
items.summary: In recent trading, KOSPI surged 3.13% to 5,522.27, NSE 20 up 3.06%, while S&P/TSX fell 2.37% to 32,465.28 and Hang Seng dropped 1.72% to 26,567.12. SENSEX rose 0.79% to 83,277.15 as of February 16.

items.title: AI Disruption Weighs on Markets as Equities Face Dispersion Risks
items.summary: Concerns over AI-led disruption in sectors like real estate, trucking, and financial services contributed to recent weakness, with S&P 500 and Dow posting four losing weeks out of five, and Nasdaq five straight negative weeks. Strategists highlight positive equity backdrop post-CPI but warn of volatility in AI-exposed stocks.

items.title: Europe's Stoxx 600 Gains Slightly in Thin Holiday Trade
items.summary: Europe's Stoxx 600 index rose 0.1% with NatWest Group up 4.8% after Citigroup price target hike; S&P 500 futures flat and Nasdaq 100 futures down 0.2%. Upcoming data includes ADP payrolls and Fed January minutes.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Predicted to Crash to $10,000 Amid Crypto Bubble Implosion
items.summary: Analyst Peter McGlone warns Bitcoin could fall another 85% to $10,000 as the crypto bubble implodes, following a 30% drop in the past month and $2 trillion market wipeout. Bitcoin is down 2.2% in the past 24 hours to $68,717, with $678 million in ETF outflows in February.[1]

items.title: Bitcoin Holds Steady at $68K in Holiday-Thinned Trading Despite Recent Rout
items.summary: Bitcoin trades around $68,000 after nearly falling below $60,000 last week, amid a 50% wipeout from October highs due to U.S. monetary policy concerns under potential Fed Chair Kevin Warsh. Ethereum up 0.9% to $1,976, with altcoins like XRP, BNB, Solana, and Cardano gaining 1.4-3%.[2]

items.title: Bitcoin Traders Brace for $60K Drop as Liquidations Loom
items.summary: Market analysis highlights Bitcoin traders preparing for a potential shock to $60,000 levels amid ongoing volatility and holiday-thinned Asian trade influenced by Lunar New Year. Broader market caution noted with central banks exhibiting restraint.[3]

items.title: Bitcoin Plunges to $60,000 with Over $2 Billion in Losses
items.summary: Bitcoin's drop to the $60,000 range in February 2026 signals a major capitulation phase after sustained selling pressure, resulting in losses exceeding $2 billion. This continues the broader crypto market downturn.[4]

items.title: US Treasury Secretary Bessent Backs Crypto Legislation for Price Boost
items.summary: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent states that crypto legislation like the Clarity Act will enhance investor confidence and support price recovery. Institutions like BlackRock and Goldman Sachs are increasing Bitcoin and Ethereum exposure despite market jitters.[1]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: India AI Impact Summit 2026 Day 2: India Provides 33% More Data to ChatGPT than US
items.summary: Day 2 of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi features discussions on AI's economic impact, healthcare deployment, and child safety, with French President Macron attending. The event, inaugurated by PM Modi, includes an expo with 600 startups and 13 country pavilions, drawing over 250,000 visitors.[1]

items.title: Fujitsu Launches AI-Driven Software Development Platform Automating Full Lifecycle
items.summary: Fujitsu announced an AI platform that automates software development from requirements to testing, learning human intelligence for accuracy, to be applied to all 67 medical and government software packages by end of FY2026.[2]

items.title: MagneX: New ML Software Accelerates Spintronic Device Modeling
items.summary: Scientists unveiled MagneX, an open-source tool using GPU acceleration, multirate integration, and machine learning surrogates like Fourier Neural Operators to efficiently simulate nanoscale magnetism for spintronics and data storage advances.[3]

items.title: Infosys and Anthropic Partner to Deploy AI Agents in Regulated Industries
items.summary: Infosys and Anthropic collaborate to integrate Claude models with Infosys Topaz for AI agents in telecom, finance, manufacturing, and software, starting with a Telecom Center of Excellence for compliant, transparent AI workflows.[4]

items.title: DEV Expands Services with AI-Driven Cybersecurity Engineering
items.summary: DEV announced expansion of cybersecurity software development services, incorporating AI-driven security engineering to enhance protections.[6]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Avowed Launches on PS5 with Anniversary Update on Xbox/PC
items.summary: Obsidian's first-person RPG Avowed releases on PlayStation 5 today, February 17, alongside an Anniversary Update for Xbox and PC versions.

items.title: PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium February 2026 Games Revealed, Led by Marvel’s Spider-Man 2
items.summary: Starting February 17, PS Plus adds Marvel’s Spider-Man 2, Test Drive Unlimited Solar Crown, Neva, Monster Hunter Stories duo, and more to Extra catalog; Premium gets Disney Pixar Wall-E.

items.title: PS Plus February 2026 Games Rolling Out Now Across Regions
items.summary: PS Plus Extra and Premium games for February, including Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 and others, begin appearing on PS Store starting February 17 in Japan/Asia, with global rollout following.

items.title: Subnautica Releases on Switch 2 February 17
items.summary: The iconic underwater exploration game Subnautica launches on Nintendo Switch 2 today, February 17, 2026.

items.title: Control Resonant Gameplay Revealed at February 2026 State of Play
items.summary: Remedy's Control Resonant received its first proper gameplay showcase during Sony's February 2026 State of Play event.

items.title: Indie Games Spotlight: WiZmans World Re;Try, Dead in Antares, and More for Week of Feb 16-22
items.summary: This week's indie releases include WiZmans World Re;Try, Dead in Antares, Dobbel Dungeon, Forgotlings, Key Fairy, and others launching between February 16-22.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
